column1: Kingdom did not agree with the Court of Appeal and unanimously allowed
the appeal. Lord Kerr held at para 52:

column2: The idea that a fraudulent individual should profit from passivity or
lack of reasonable diligence on the part of his or her opponent seems
justice.  Quite  apart  from  this,  the
defrauder, in obtaining a judgment, has perpetrated a deception not

column1: only on their opponent and the court but on the rule of law.
